1.text: Remove the pillowcase to clean in a washing machine.

2.text: Wash the pillow in soapy water if it needs cleaning.

3.text: Press down on the pillow to force excess moisture out of it.

4.text: Move the pillow to a warm spot with plenty of air circulation.

5.text: Wait 4 hours for the pillow to dry.

6.text: Remove the pillowcase and protector to wash them separately.

7.text: Blot the spill with a clean towel to absorb as much of it as possible.

8.text: Mix a mild dish soap into lukewarm water to treat the stain.

9.text: Wipe soap off with a clean, damp cloth if you used any.

10.text: Pat the pillow with a dry towel to clear moisture off its surface.

11.text: Place the pillow in an open area with plenty of sunlight.

12.text: Wait 15 to 30 minutes for the pillow to finish drying.

13.text: Clean stains with a mixture of soap and water.

14.text: Move the pillow to a warm area out in the open to dry.

15.text: Sprinkle baking soda to cover damp spots on the pillow.

16.text: Wait up to 4 hours for the pillow to dry out.

17.text: Vacuum up the baking soda to clean up the pillow.
